programme.title: L'avenir nous appartient
programme.desc: Episode 7 Architect Kim Pariseau is fighting against wasted space. Christine Renaud has co-founded La Cabane Familiale to help school drop-outs. Astronaut David Saint-Jacques has launched an energetic plea in favour of dreaming. Caroline Codsi has introduced a certification system to measure gender equality. Jewellery by Cinderella Garbage is designed using "rubbish". Directed by: Jean-François Poisson (Canada, 2021)

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc:
Turkey: Erdoğan's cards
Pivotal country at the crossroads between Europe, Russia, Caucasia and the Middle East, Turkey has as many partners as it has potential rivals. A master in this complex game Recep Tayyip Erdoğan knows exactly which card to play. But is the Turkish president's hand good enough to achieve his ambitions?
Presented by: Émilie Aubry.

programme.title: Le vrai nouveau monde
programme.desc:
Fleeing, to find your place Gregory Charles meets two war refugees. Teacher and author, Maya Ombasic was born in ex-Yugoslavia, a country she had to leave as a teenager. Whereas, Steven Miruho had been forced to leave Congo, his native country, and spent ten years in a refugee camp before being accepted in Quebec.

Directed by: Sophie Lambert (Canada, 2019) With Gregory Charles

programme.title: Ding dong : montre-moi ta maison !
programme.desc:
Episode 1

A little crooked house... but can a house really be crooked, literally? Who lives in a villa with direct lake access? How to blossom in a rainbow-coloured house next to a railway line? Viola Tami invites us to discover some surprising buildings and their occupants. Presented by: Viola Tami.

Directed by: Karen Ballmer (Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Awakening the senses in Brière
Éric Guérin, Michelin-starred chef, has worked in the greatest Parisian restaurants. But it was in the heart of the Brière Regional Natural Park that, twenty-five years ago, he decided to open his own gastronomic restaurant, La Mare aux Oiseaux. Just like its creator, it is generous, modern and welcoming. Directed by: Christian Roche.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
French patisserie, a know-how that is totally unique
Where did the first "pastries" come from? Which pastry chef made them famous? And what's the link between a Paris-Brest and cycling? Jamy and his team indulge us with stories and anecdotes about the pastries that helped to make French gastronomy famous.
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
1348 BC, the Akhenaton event/17 October 1961, a colonial massacre in Paris
Between the years IV and VI of his reign, the Pharaoh Amenhotep IV changed religion and name to become Akhenaton. Responding to a call by the FLN, 20 to 30,000 Algerians peacefully marched through Paris. What followed was the most violent state repression provoked by a street demonstration in Europe.
Directed by: Florence Tran, Juliette Garcias (France, 2020)

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Les Sables-d'Olonne, with Isabelle Vitari
Today we're in Les Sables-d'Olonne, on the legendary pontoon used for the Vendée Globe and where Mory will be cooking winkles. To spice up his dish he'll be adding curry and Mexican chili pepper, all with the able assistance of actress Isabelle Vitari.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: C Jamy
programme.desc:
French patisserie, a know-how that is totally unique
Where did the first "pastries" come from? Which pastry chef made them famous? And what's the link between a Paris-Brest and cycling? Jamy and his team indulge us with stories and anecdotes about the pastries that helped to make French gastronomy famous.
Presented by: Jamy Gourmaud.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Awakening the senses in Brière
Éric Guérin, Michelin-starred chef, has worked in the greatest Parisian restaurants. But it was in the heart of the Brière Regional Natural Park that, twenty-five years ago, he decided to open his own gastronomic restaurant, La Mare aux Oiseaux. Just like its creator, it is generous, modern and welcoming. Directed by: Christian Roche.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Les petites bulles
programme.desc: Hedgehogs Ever since she founded SOS Hedgehogs, more than 145 of these prickly little animals have passed through the hands of the carer Christina Meissner.

programme.title: Les contes de Lupin
programme.sub-title: La sirène bricoleuse et les pirates

programme.title: Rocky & Lily : c'est dans la boîte !
programme.desc:
Profession: firefighter
The studio has been transformed into a fire station, so real that Rocky believes he's actually there! We learn all about two different types of firefighter: professional firefighters and volunteer firefighters.
Directed by: Angelo Abou Hatem (season 2, Belgium, 2021) With Aurélie Martinez and Romain Angeveld

programme.title: Cuisine ouverte
programme.desc:
In Les Sables-d'Olonne, with Isabelle Vitari
Today we're in Les Sables-d'Olonne, on the legendary pontoon used for the Vendée Globe and where Mory will be cooking winkles. To spice up his dish he'll be adding curry and Mexican chili pepper, all with the able assistance of actress Isabelle Vitari.
Presented by: Mory Sacko.

programme.title: Échappées belles
programme.desc: Week-end in Saint-Malo A weekend in Saint-Malo, nestling within its famous ramparts, is a chance to discover fabulous scenery, legends, expertise and, above all, a local population whose generosity, creativity and energy know no bounds. Jérôme Pitorin sets off to explore this harbour town, former stronghold of the fearsome corsairs. Presented by: Jérôme Pitorin.

programme.title: Don Juan
programme.desc:
Abandoned on his wedding day, Laurent, an actor playing the stage role of Don Juan, can't stop himself from seeing his ex-fiancée in all the women he comes across. Attempting to soothe his broken heart, he tries chatting them up, but none are interested...

Directed by: Serge Bozon (France/Belgium, 2022)

Cast: Tahar Rahim, Virginie Efira, Alain Chamfort, Damien Chapelle

Genre: Dramedy

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.desc:
Episode 3: On the eve of the 4th murder

Constance and her team are now leading three investigations: a triple murder, Sylvain's attempted murder and the explosion that blew up the caravan. The list of suspects lengthens. Constance thinks that Marlène, Mike Pratt's mistress and accountant, is involved. But the priority is to find Joël Savard before his enemies.

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux

Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Faits divers
programme.sub-title: Les heures avant qu'on efface les traces
programme.desc:
Episode 4: The hours before all traces are effaced

During the questioning, Constance sows the seeds of doubt in Mike Pratt's mind. Did Marlène order Nancy's murder, behind her lover's back? Rodrigue Rancourt's disappearance remains a mystery. Anne Dupuis tries to cover up the evidence of her crime...

Directed by: Stéphane Lapointe (season 1, Canada, 2017)

Screenplay: Joanne Arseneau

Cast: Isabelle Blais (Constance Forest), Fred-Éric Salvail (Antoine Chevrier-Marseau), Émile Proulx-Cloutier (Frédérik Bérubé), Maxime Mailloux (Jonas), Fabien Cloutier (Mike Pratt), Mylène Mackay (Marlène Charbonneau), David Boutin (Éric Charbonneau), Marie-Ève Beaulieu (Anne Dupuis), Patrick Hivon (Sylvain Lauzon), Alexa-Jeanne Dubé (Zoé Forest), Francis LaHaye (Joël Savard), Guy Nadon (Serge Forest)

Genre: thriller

Awards: best performance by an actor in a leading role in a dramatic series (Fabien Cloutier) at the 2018 Gémeaux Parental guidance: not recommended for children under the age of 10 (-10)

programme.title: Quand l'histoire fait dates
programme.desc:
315, the Donation of Constantine/29 May 1453, the capture of Constantinople
The Donation of Constantine, one of the most influential mediaeval texts, legitimised the Popes' temporal power. In 1440, it was refuted by the humanist Lorenzo Valla. In 1453, the capture of Constantinople marked the fall of the Byzantine Empire, and the end of any understanding between East and West.
Directed by: Denis Van Waerebeke, Benoît Laborde (France, 2019)
